subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For you have judged in my favor; from your throne you have judged with fairness. 5 You have rebuked the nations and destroyed the wicked; you have erased their names forever. 6 The enemy is finished, in endless ruins; the cities you uprooted are now forgotten. 7 But the Lord reigns forever, executing judgment from his throne. 8 He will judge the world with justice and rule the nations with fairness. 9 The Lord is a shelter for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.
reflection: God upholds our just cause; He is our vindicator (one who clears us from criticism and justifies us before others. ) In this life we may face many injustices: (1) We may be falsely accused and misunderstood by friends and enemies; (2) We may not be fully appreciated by others for the love we show; (3) The true value of our work and service may not be duly rewarded; (4) Our ideas may be ignored. But God is to be praised, for He sees and remembers all the good we do, and it is up to Him to decide the timing and the appropriateness of our rewards. If we do not trust Him to vindicate us, then we will be susceptible to hatred and self-pity. If we do trust Him, we can experience God's peace, and be free from worry of how others perceive us and treat us. . .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father give me the patience to wait on Your timing. I thank You also, for the peace that is freely given when I place my trust in You. I pray that I would be obedient to Your Holy Spirit's guidance. Give me a teachable spirit I pray. . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalms 9:4-9 (NLT)

For you have judged in my favor; from your throne you have judged with
fairness.

5 You have rebuked the nations and destroyed the wicked; you have erased
their names forever.

6 The enemy is finished, in endless ruins; the cities you uprooted are now
forgotten. 
7 But the Lord reigns forever, executing judgment from his throne.

8 He will judge the world with justice and rule the nations with fairness.

9 The Lord is a shelter for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble. 



Today's Thoughts:

God upholds our just cause; He is our vindicator (one who clears us from
criticism and justifies us before others.)

In this life we may face many injustices:

(1) We may be falsely accused and misunderstood by friends and enemies;

(2) We may not be fully appreciated by others for the love we show;

(3) The true value of our work and service may not be duly rewarded;

(4) Our ideas may be ignored.

But God is to be praised, for He sees and remembers all the good we do,

and it is up to Him to decide the timing and the appropriateness of our
rewards.

If we do not trust Him to vindicate us, then we will be susceptible to
hatred and self-pity.

If we do trust Him, we can experience God's peace, and be free from worry of
how others perceive us and treat us. . .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father give me the patience to wait on Your timing.

I thank You also, for the peace that is freely given when I place my trust
in You.

I pray that I would be obedient to Your Holy Spirit's guidance. 

Give me a teachable spirit I pray. . Amen.



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

We will be going up north for a week and a half so I won't be sending any
Morning Devotions-Sorry! ! !



Phil. 4:8 Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 10 Those who know Your name trust in You, for You, O Lord, do not abandon those who search for You. Psalms 9:10 (NLT)
reflection: God will never abandon those who seek Him. God's promise does not mean that if we trust Him we will escape lose or suffering; it means that God Himself will never leave us no matter what we face.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for the promise that You will never leave me nor forsake me. I thank You for Your grace and mercies which are new every day. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse:

10 Those who know Your name trust in You, for You, O Lord, do not abandon
those who search for You. 

Psalms 9:10 (NLT)



Today's Thoughts:

God will never abandon those who seek Him. God's promise does not mean that
if we trust Him we 

will escape lose or suffering; it means that God Himself will never leave
us no matter what we face.



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, I thank You for the promise that You will never leave me nor
forsake me.

I thank You for Your grace and mercies which are new every day. . . Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 11 Sing praises to the Lord who reigns in Jerusalem. Tell the world about his unforgettable deeds. 12 For he who avenges murder cares for the helpless. He does not ignore the cries of those who suffer. 13 Lord, have mercy on me. See how my enemies torment me. Snatch me back from the jaws of death. 14 Save me so I can praise you publicly at Jerusalem's gates, so I can rejoice that you have rescued me.
reflection: God does not only live in Jerusalem (or Zion, another name for Mount Moriah, the hill on which the temple was built); He lives everywhere all the time. . . From this central point the Jews were to tell the world about the one true God. All of us want God to help us when we are in trouble, but often for different reasons. Some people want God to help them so they will be successful and other people will like them. Others want God to help them so they will be comfortable and feel good about themselves. David wanted help from God so that justice would be restored to Israel and so he could show others God's power. When you call to God for help, consider your motive. Is it to save yourself pain and embarrassment or to bring God glory and honor?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father Help me to be sensitive to Your Holy Spirits guidance so that my motives would always be just, so that my requests would only be to give you honor and glory. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalms 9:11-14 (NLT)

11 Sing praises to the Lord who reigns in Jerusalem. Tell the world about
his unforgettable deeds.

12 For he who avenges murder cares for the helpless. He does not ignore the
cries of those who suffer. 
13 Lord, have mercy on me. See how my enemies torment me. Snatch me back
from the jaws of death.

14 Save me so I can praise you publicly at Jerusalem's gates, so I can
rejoice that you have rescued me. 



Today's Thoughts:

God does not only live in Jerusalem (or Zion, another name for Mount Moriah,
the hill on which the temple was built);

He lives everywhere all the time. . . From this central point the Jews were
to tell the world about the one true God.



All of us want God to help us when we are in trouble, but often for
different reasons. 

Some people want God to help them so they will be successful and other
people will

like them. Others want God to help them so they will be comfortable and
feel good

about themselves. 



David wanted help from God so that justice would be restored to Israel and
so he could

show others God's power.



When you call to God for help, consider your motive. Is it to save yourself
pain and

embarrassment or to bring God glory and honor? 



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father Help me to be sensitive to Your Holy Spirits guidance
so that

my motives would always be just, so that my requests would only be to give
you honor 

and glory. . . Amen.



Pastor AL & Marcie Sather

I Cor. 3:20 The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are
worthless.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 16 The Lord is known for his justice. The wicked are trapped by their own deeds. 17 The wicked will go down to the grave. This is the fate of all the nations who ignore God. 18 But the needy will not be ignored forever; the hopes of the poor will not always be crushed.
reflection: The Lord alone is our only hope. The Lord knows our every need, He will not remain silent forever. He will come to the aid of all who call upon Him.
prayer: I thank You O Lord, that You Love and care for Your people. Let not my enemies triumph over me. Open my eyes that I may see all the wonders thy hands have made. . . Amen.
original_content:

18 But the needy will not be ignored forever; the hopes of the poor will not

Today's Thoughts:
The Lord alone is our only hope. The Lord knows our every need, He will not

forever. He will come to the aid of all who call upon Him.

over me. Open my eyes that I may see all the wonders thy hands have made. .
. Amen.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
Phil. 4:8 Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 19 Arise, O Lord! Do not let mere mortals defy you! Judge the nations! 20 Make them tremble in fear, O Lord. Let the nations know they are merely human.
reflection: If you are facing battles you feel you can't possible win, don't give up. In the midst of numerous problems, pray for God's help, admit to Him that you are powerless. . . The secret of victory is to first admit to the futility of unaided human effort and then to trust God to save. His power works best through those who recognize their limitations (2 Corinthians 12:9). It is those who think they can do it all, on their own who are in the greatest danger. . .
prayer: Dear Lord forgive me for the times I have attempted to take on difficult situations and failed because I did not trust in You for the help I needed. Help me see my limitations. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalms 9:19-20 (NLT)

19 Arise, O Lord! Do not let mere mortals defy you! Judge the nations!

20 Make them tremble in fear, O Lord. Let the nations know they are merely
human. 



Today's Thoughts:

If you are facing battles you feel you can't possible win, don't give up.

In the midst of numerous problems, pray for God's help, admit to Him

that you are powerless. . .



The secret of victory is to first admit to the futility of unaided human
effort

and then to trust God to save. His power works best through those who 

recognize their limitations (2 Cor. 12:9).



It is those who think they can do it all, on their own who are in the
greatest danger. . . 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord forgive me for the times I have attempted to take on difficult
situations and 

failed because I did not trust in You for the help I needed. Help me see my
limitations.Amen.



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

"Fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom." Pro. 1:7

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: O Lord, why do you stand so far away? Why do you hide when I am in trouble?
reflection: "Why do You hide when I need You the most?" to the psalmist, God seemed far away. But even though the writer had honest doubts, he did not stop praying or conclude that God no longer cared. He was not complaining but simply asking God to hurry to his aid. It is during those times when we feel the most alone or oppressed that we need to keep praying, telling God about our troubles. . .
prayer: Dear Lord it is during the trials of life that You seem so far away, but I have found that they are meant to cause my faith to grow. Help me to be mindful that You are never any further away than a prayer so that my faith in You will grow stronger. Guide and direct me that I may never stop praying. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalms 10:1 (NLT)

O Lord, why do you stand so far away? Why do you hide when I am in trouble?



Today's Thoughts:

"Why do You hide when I need You the most?" to the psalmist, God seemed far
away.

But even though the writer had honest doubts, he did not stop praying or
conclude that

God no longer cared. He was not complaining but simply asking God to hurry
to his aid.



It is during those times when we feel the most alone or oppressed that we
need to keep 

praying, telling God about our troubles. . . 



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord it is during the trials of life that You seem so far away, but I
have found that

they are meant to cause my faith to grow. Help me to be mindful that You are
never any

further away than a prayer so that my faith in You will grow stronger. Guide
and direct

me that I may never stop praying. . . Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth." Palsm 100-:1

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 4 The wicked are too proud to seek God. They seem to think that God is dead 5 Yet they succeed in everything they do. They do not see your punishment awaiting them. They sneer at all their enemies. 6 They think, "Nothing bad will ever happen to us! We will be free of trouble forever!"
reflection: Some people succeed in everything they do, and they brag that no one, not even God, can keep them down. We may wonder why God allow them to gain great wealth, while they despise Him as they do. BUT why are we upset when the wicked prosper? Are we angry about the damage they are doing, or just jealous of their success? To answer these questions, we must gain the right perspective on wickedness and wealth. The wicked will surely be punished because God hates their evil deeds. Wealth is only temporary, it is not necessarily a sign of God's approval on a person's life, nor a lack of it a sign of God's disapproval. . . Don't let wealth become your obsession
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to always have the right perspective of situations in life that are cloudy to me. Help me remember that the riches of this life are only temporary. Help me set my sights on the eternal riches You wish for me. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalms 10:4-6 (NLT)

4 The wicked are too proud to seek God. They seem to think that God is dead

5 Yet they succeed in everything they do. They do not see your punishment
awaiting them. They sneer at all their enemies.

6 They think, "Nothing bad will ever happen to us! We will be free of
trouble forever!" 



Today's Thoughts:

Some people succeed in everything they do, and they brag that no one, not
even God,

can keep them down. We may wonder why God allow them to gain great wealth,

while they despise Him as they do. 



BUT why are we upset when the wicked prosper?

Are we angry about the damage they are doing, or just jealous of their
success?

To answer these questions, we must gain the right perspective on wickedness
and wealth.

The wicked will surely be punished because God hates their evil deeds.

Wealth is only temporary, it is not necessarily a sign of God's approval on
a person's life,

nor a lack of it a sign of God's disapproval. . . Don't let wealth become
your obsession



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, help me to always have the right perspective of situations in
life that are

cloudy to me. Help me remember that the riches of this life are only
temporary.

Help me set my sights on the eternal riches You wish for me. . . Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 7 Their mouths are full of cursing, lies, and threats. Trouble and evil are on the tips of their tongues. 8 They lurk in ambush in the villages, waiting to murder innocent people. They are always searching for helpless victims. 9 Like lions crouched in hiding, they wait to pounce on the helpless. Like hunters they capture the helpless and drag them away in nets. 10 Their helpless victims are crushed; they fall beneath the strength of the wicked. 11 The wicked think, "God isn't watching us! He has closed his eyes and won't even see what we do!"
reflection: Have you ever said to yourself -"Well I'm not to bad. I'm a pretty good person. " Look at these verses again and see if any of them apply to you. Have you ever lied? Have you ever hurt someone's feelings by your words or tone of voice/? Are you bitter toward anyone? Do you become angry with those who strongly disagree with you? In thought word and deed, you like everyone else in the world, stand guilty before God. We must remember who we are in His sight-alienated sinners. Don't deny that you are a sinner. Instead, allow your desperate need to point you to God
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father I have to confess that I have sinned against You in thought-word-and deed, for Wich I have no excuse other than I am a sinful human being-I beg for Your forgiveness. . . Amen
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalms 10:7-11 (NLT)

7 Their mouths are full of cursing, lies, and threats. Trouble and evil are
on the tips of their tongues.

8 They lurk in ambush in the villages, waiting to murder innocent people.
They are always searching for helpless victims.

9 Like lions crouched in hiding, they wait to pounce on the helpless. Like
hunters they capture the helpless and drag them away in nets.

10 Their helpless victims are crushed; they fall beneath the strength of the
wicked.

11 The wicked think, "God isn't watching us! He has closed his eyes and
won't even see what we do!" 



Today's Thoughts:

Have you ever said to yourself-"Well I'm not to bad. I'm a pretty good
person."

Look at these verses again and see if any of them apply to you.

Have you ever lied? Have you ever hurt someone's feelings by your words or
tone of voice/?

Are you bitter toward anyone? Do you become angry with those who strongly
disagree with you?

In thought word and deed, you like everyone else in the world, stand guilty
before God.

We must remember who we are in His sight-alienated sinners.

Don't deny that you are a sinner. Instead, allow your desperate need to
point you to God



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father I have to confess that I have sinned against You in
thought-word-and deed, for 

Wich I have no excuse other than I am a sinful human being-I beg for Your
forgiveness. . . Amen 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Why do the wicked get away with despising God? They think, "God will never call us to account. " 14 But you see the trouble and grief they cause. You take note of it and punish them. The helpless put their trust in you. You defend the orphans.
reflection: God sees and take note of each evil deed-He encourages us, and listens to our cries. He fulfills the desires of those who fear Him; He hears their cries for help and rescues them. He is always with us-We can face the wicked because we do not face them aloneGod is by our side.
prayer: I thank You Lord for Your faithfulness. I thank You that You hear our cries and come to our aid. . . Amen.
original_content:

Why do the wicked get away with despising God? They think, "God will never
call us to account."

14 But you see the trouble and grief they cause. You take note of it and
punish them. The helpless put their trust in you. You defend the orphans. 



Today's Thoughts"

God sees and take note of each evil deed-He encourages us, and listens to
our cries.

He fulfills the desires of those who fear Him; He hears their cries for help
and rescues them.

He is always with us-We can face the wicked because we do not face them
aloneGod is by our side.

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

I thank You Lord for Your faithfulness. I thank You that You hear our cries
and come to our aid. . . Amen.



Pastor AL & Marcie Sather

I Cor. 3:20 The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are
worthless.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I trust in the Lord for protection. So why do you say to me, "Fly like a bird to the mountains for safety! 2 The wicked are stringing their bows and fitting their arrows on the bowstrings. They shoot from the shadows at those whose hearts are right. 3 The foundations of law and order have collapsed. What can the righteous do?" 4 But the Lord is in his holy Temple; the Lord still rules from heaven. He watches everyone closely, examining every person on earth.
reflection: David was forced to flee for safety several times. Even being God's anointed king did not make him immune to injustice and hatred from others. David fled, but not as if all was lost. He knew that God was in control-While David wisely avoided trouble, he did not fearfully run away from his troubles. David was comforted and optimistic because he knew God was greater than anything his enemies could bring against him. Let us not forget that faith in God keeps us from losing hope and helps us resist fear.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You, for being in control of all situations. Much like in the day of David I often believe that the foundation of the Law is collapsing. It seems as though evil has the upper hand. But I know that You are always watching and that in the end righteousness will win out. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalms 11:1-4 (NLT)

I trust in the Lord for protection. So why do you say to me, "Fly like a
bird to the mountains for safety!

2 The wicked are stringing their bows and fitting their arrows on the
bowstrings. They shoot from the shadows at those whose hearts are right.

3 The foundations of law and order have collapsed. What can the righteous
do?" 
4 But the Lord is in his holy Temple; the Lord still rules from heaven. He
watches everyone closely, examining every person on earth. 



Today's thoughts:

David was forced to flee for safety several times. Even being God's anointed
king did not make him immune to injustice

and hatred from others. David fled, but not as if all was lost. He knew that
God was in control-While David wisely

avoided trouble, he did not fearfully run away from his troubles. David was
comforted and optimistic because he

knew God was greater than anything his enemies could bring against him.



Let us not forget that faith in God keeps us from losing hope and helps us
resist fear.



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, I thank You, for being in control of all situations. Much like in
the day of David I often believe that the

foundation of the Law is collapsing. It seems as though evil has the upper
hand. But I know that You are always 

watching and that in the end righteousness will win out. . . Amen.



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

"Fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom." Pro. 1:7

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 5 The Lord examines both the righteous and the wicked. He hates those who love violence. 6 He will rain down blazing coals and burning sulfur on the wicked, punishing them with scorching winds. 7 For the righteous Lord loves justice. The virtuous will see his face.
reflection: We've probably all have discovered the fact that God does not always preserve believers from difficult circumstances. BUT He examines (or tests) both the righteous and the wicked. For some-God's tests become a refining firewhile for others, the tests become an incinerator for destruction. Don't ignore or defy the tests and challenges that come your way-use them as opportunities to grow. . . God is still in control. . .
prayer: I thank You Lord, for Your love and mercy for You have guided and protected me from many difficult circumstances. Because of this fact my faith in You has grown. I pray for the health and safety of all who read this e-mail. . . Amen.

Worship the LORD with gladness; 
come before him with joyful songs. Psalm 100:2

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 1 Help, O Lord, for the godly are fast disappearing! The faithful have vanished from the earth!
reflection: This is a thought that may come to our minds too. Yes living for God in a deceitful world can be difficult and lonely battle. At one time the great prophet Elijah felt so lonely He wanted to die. But God told him that there were 7, 000 other faithful servants (I Kg. 19:4, 14, 18) Let us remember we are never alone in our battle against evil-when you feel alone seek out other believers for strength and support. . .
prayer: Thank Lord, for being close at hand when I find myself in a battle against evil. You are my strength and ever present help in times of trouble. . . Amen.
original_content:

This is a thought that may come to our minds too. Yes living for God in a

wanted to die. But God told him that there were 7,000 other faithful

Let us remember we are never alone in our battle against evil-when you feel

other believers for strength and support. . .

I will thank the Lord because He is just;

I will sing praises to the name of the Lord Most High. Ps. 7:17

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 5 The Lord replies, "I have seen violence done to the helpless, and I have heard the groans of the poor. Now I will rise up to rescue them, as they have longed for me to do. "
reflection: Oh yes, we need not fear, God cares about the helpless. Here we see that He promises to rescue the helpless and confront their oppressors. Shouldn't we identify with God's attitude? His work is not done until we care for the needs of the poor. Let us remember to have faith in God's timing-But let us also be faithful in fulfilling our part in the care of those less fortunate.
prayer: I thank you Lord, for Your faithfulness! Help me to remain faithful to Your commands. Help me to be more caring of those who are less fortunate. . Amen.

I Cor. 3:20 The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are
worthless.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The Lord's promises are pure, like silver refined in a furnace, purified seven times over.
reflection: Sincerity and truth are extremely valuable because they are becoming more and more rare. Many people have become deceivers, liars, and flatterers-they believe they will get what they want by deception. As a king David certainly faced these kind of people, who hoped to win his favor and gain advancement through flattery. When we feel as though sincerity and truth have nearly gone out of existence, we still have on hope. . . That hope is the Word of God-God's words are as flawless as refined silver. So we need to listen closely when He speaks.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, as You know the world has become filled with those who want to get ahead by deceit. We need to become more wise than a fox, while we keep our focus on You. Help us to be more sensitive to You Holy Spirit's guidance. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalms 12:6 (NLT)

The Lord's promises are pure, like silver refined in a furnace, purified
seven times over. 



Today's Thoughts:

Sincerity and truth are extremely valuable because they are becoming more
and more rare.

Many people have become deceivers, liars, and flatterers-they believe they
will get what 

they want by deception. As a king David certainly faced these kind of
people, who hoped 

to win his favor and gain advancement through flattery. When we feel as
though sincerity 

and truth have nearly gone out of existence, we still have on hope. . .



That hope is the Word of God-God's words are as flawless as refined silverSo we need to listen closely when He speaks.



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, as You know the world has become filled with those who

want to get ahead by deceit. We need to become more wise than a fox, while
we

keep our focus on You. Help us to be more sensitive to You Holy Spirit's
guidance. . . Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: O Lord, how long will you forget me? Forever? How long will you look the other way? 2 How long must I struggle with anguish in my soul, with sorrow in my heart every day? How long will my enemy have the upper hand? 3 Turn and answer me, O Lord my God! Restore the sparkle to my eyes, or I will die. 4 Don't let my enemies gloat, saying, "We have defeated him!" Don't let them rejoice at my downfall. 5 But I trust in your unfailing love. I will rejoice because you have rescued me.
reflection: (Sometimes)-all we need to do is talk over our problem with a friend to help put it into perspective. David frequently claimed that God was slow to react on his behalf. I believe we too often feel this same impatience. Often it seems that evil and sufferings go unchecked, and we wonder when God is going to stop them. But David affirmed that he would continue to trust God no matter how long he would have to wait for God's justice to materialize. . . Through prayer we can express our feelings and take our problems to God. He will help us regain the right perspective, and this will give us peace of mind.
prayer: Dear Lord, You have been so patient with me. You continued to draw me to Your forgiving heart. Grant that I may learn from You to be patient with others thoughtful and considerate, even though they irritate and upset me. Remove from my heart all resentment toward those who upset me by their words and actions. Let me lean on You for strength and guidance and wait on Your time. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalms 13:1-5 (NLT)
O Lord, how long will you forget me? Forever? How long will you look the
other way?
2 How long must I struggle with anguish in my soul, with sorrow in my heart
every day? How long will my enemy have the upper hand? 
3 Turn and answer me, O Lord my God! Restore the sparkle to my eyes, or I
will die.
4 Don't let my enemies gloat, saying, "We have defeated him!" Don't let them
rejoice at my downfall. 
5 But I trust in your unfailing love. I will rejoice because you have
rescued me. 
Today's Thoughts:
(Sometimes)-all we need to do is talk over our problem with a friend to help
put it into perspective.
David frequently claimed that God was slow to react on his behalf. I believe
we too often feel this
same impatience. Often it seems that evil and sufferings go unchecked, and
we wonder when God 
is going to stop them. But David affirmed that he would continue to trust
God no matter how long 
he would have to wait for God's justice to materialize. . .

Through prayer we can express our feelings and take our problems to God. He
will help us regain 
the right perspective, and this will give us peace of mind.
Today's Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, You have been so patient with me. You continued to draw me to
Your forgiving heart.
Grant that I may learn from You to be patient with others thoughtful and
considerate, even though 
they irritate and upset me. Remove from my heart all resentment toward
those who upset me by 
their words and actions. Let me lean on You for strength and guidance and
wait on Your time. . . Amen.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
Phil. 4:8 Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 4 Will those who do evil never learn? They eat up my people like bread and wouldn't think of praying to the Lord. 5 Terror will grip them, for God is with those who obey him. 6 The wicked frustrate the plans of the oppressed, but the Lord will protect his people.
reflection: There is a clear distinction between those who worship God AND those who refuse to. Under the leadership of David Israel prospered-BUT several hundred years later, Israel forgot God, and it became difficult to distinguish between God's followers and those who worshiped idols. . . When Isaiah called Israel to repentance, he like David, spoke of people who had gone astray (Isaiah 53:6)-But Isaiah was talking about the Israelites themselves. Paul quoted (Psalms 13) in (Romans 3:10-12). He made the image of straying sheep even more general-referring to all people. Let us not be fooled the whole human race-Jews and Gentiles alike-have turned away from God. BUT don't forget the words of vs. 5 and 6 we are not fighting a losing battle our ultimate victory is in God. . .
prayer: Oh Lord we live in a sad generation-sin in the world has become so prevalent-without You there would be no victory, but those who will obey You-You will protect and victory will come from You. Thanks for that. . . Amen
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalms 14:4-6 (NLT)

4 Will those who do evil never learn? They eat up my people like bread and
wouldn't think of praying to the Lord.

5 Terror will grip them, for God is with those who obey him.

6 The wicked frustrate the plans of the oppressed, but the Lord will protect
his people. 

Today's Thoughts:

There is a clear distinction between those who worship God AND those who
refuse to.

Under the leadership of David Israel prospered-BUT several hundred years
later, Israel

forgot God, and it became difficult to distinguish between God's followers
and those

who worshiped idols. . .



When Isaiah called Israel to repentance, he like David, spoke of people who
had gone astray

(Isa. 53:6)-But Isaiah was talking about the Israelites themselves. Paul
quoted (Ps. 13) in

(Ro. 3:10-12). He made the image of straying sheep even more
general-referring to all people.



Let us not be fooled the whole human race-Jews and Gentiles alike-have
turned away from God.

BUT don't forget the words of vs. 5 and 6 we are not fighting a losing
battle our ultimate victory

is in God. . . 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Oh Lord we live in a sad generation-sin in the world has become so
prevalent-without You

there would be no victory, but those who will obey You-You will protect and
victory will 

come from You. Thanks for that. . . Amen



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Who may worship in your sanctuary, Lord? Who may enter your presence on your holy hill? 2 Those who lead blameless lives and do what is right, speaking the truth from sincere hearts.
reflection: God calls His people to be morally upright. As we work through chap. 15 He gives us 10 standards to determine how we are doing. We defiantly live among sinful people whose standards and morals are eroding. . . Our standards for living should not come from our sinful society but from God.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray for a sincere and sensitive heart that I may be led by Your Holy Spirit - in the way of righteousness. I pray that I would not become led by the sinfulness of today's society. I pray that revival would come to our country so that our society would once again seek Your truth for all people. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalms 15:1-2 (NLT)

Who may worship in your sanctuary, Lord? Who may enter your presence on your
holy hill?

2 Those who lead blameless lives and do what is right, speaking the truth
from sincere hearts. 

Today's Thoughts:

God calls His people to be morally upright. As we work through chap. 15 He
gives us 10 

standards to determine how we are doing. We defiantly live among sinful
people whose 

standards and morals are eroding. . .



Our standards for living should not come from our sinful society but from
God. 

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, I pray for a sincere and sensitive heart that I may be led by
Your

Holy Spirit-in the way of righteousness. I pray that I would not become

led by the sinfulness of today's society. I pray that revival would come to

our country so that our society would once again seek Your truth for all
people. . . Amen. 

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Those (with blameless hearts) refuse to gossip or harm their neighbors or speak evil of their friends. 4 Those who despise flagrant sinners, and honor the faithful followers of the Lord,
reflection: Remember this-words are powerful and how you use them reflects on your relationship with God. There possibly isn't anything that identifies Christians as their ability to control their speechspeaking the truth-refusing to slander-and keeping oaths (promises). Always watch what you say. . . (See what James 3:1-13 says about the importance of controlling the tongue)
prayer: Dear Lord, give me a thankful heart and the determination to live like Jesushelp me to live my thanksgiving by a reverent and cheerful obedience to Your will and by a steadfast trust in Your loving kindness and unfailing mercy. . . Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalms 15:3-4 (NLT)

Those (with blameless hearts) refuse to gossip or harm their neighbors or
speak evil of their friends.

4 Those who despise flagrant sinners, and honor the faithful followers of
the Lord, 

Today's Thoughts:

Remember this-words are powerful and how you use them reflects on your
relationship with God.

There possibly isn't anything that identifies Christians as their ability to
control their speechspeaking the truth-refusing to slander-and keeping oaths (promises). Always
watch what you say. . . 



(See what James 3:1-13 says about the importance of controlling the tongue)

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, give me a thankful heart and the determination to live like
Jesushelp me to live my thanksgiving by a reverent and cheerful obedience to

Your will and by a steadfast trust in Your loving kindness and unfailing

mercy. . . Amen.



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Phil. 4:8 Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right.
